page.title: 15Nantwich Christian Council
page.content: Ecumenism is fostered in Nantwich by the{Nantwich Christian Council. Ministers from the{Anglican, Catholic, {Methodist,and United Reformed Churches hold monthly "Fraternal Meetings", and attend Council meetings with three delegates.Their aim is to promote joint Christian liturgy through ecumenical services in each others churches and inter-denominational preaching plus joint outdoor services. Of note are those in{Holy Week,}a {Bible Sunday}and during{Christian Aid {Week.}Social initiatives have emerged such as the unemployed, who have a "drop-in" facility to meet and talk; a "listening-post" for those with problems of loneliness;pastoral work and visiting for those who need care and help, and a marriage guidance group.It can therefore be seen that the Council is important in Nantwich.
